title: Wednesday, 5th September 2018
bodyHTML:
Blank canvas good morning everyone
11:07 am
BE11:07am

Morning, hello, hi, hey there. This is Markets Live, FT Alphaville's thing with the thing.

Soundbuy Morning all..........
Excel Developer Hello
BE11:08am

It's back to school day.

Excel Developer I'll try and play along with the single stocks aspect of this room today, promise.
Excel Developer Why is Old Mutual being hammered, is it Emerging Markets turmoil?
Soundbuy I'm logging in from the bike sheds......
Pharma I know it's not BEs job, but could someone on Alphaville please zap the erstwhile [Mason.und.Dixon], now polluting the comments as f.mayweather
BE11:11am

And for everyone who spent the morning nervously bundling their children into crisp new uniforms and buffing their shoes in preparation for a new academic year, there's only one question on their mind:

11:11 am
BE11:11am

"Where do I invest if this luxury cycle is not over?"

Excel Developer Old Mutual really tumbled June 12th but nothing on the AV transcript. https://ftalphaville.ft.com/marketslive/2018-06-12/
Soundbuy Old Mutual -Mondi unloved at the open too.......an SA thingy?
BE11:12am

Well, HSBC has the answer:

BE11:12am

11:12 am
BE11:12am

130 pages on global luxury goods trends. Because that's what you want sitting on your desk at the end of an interminably long summer holiday.

BE11:13am

We'll come back to that, though. Because there's other stuff to prioritise.

undefined
VV75 morning
11:14 am
BE11:14am

Old Mutual ......

Old Mutual Ltd (OMU:LSE): Last: 148.93, down 3.61 (-2.37%), High: 156.50, Low: 144.92, Volume: 1.29m
BE11:16am

Not a huge move, no?

11:16 am
BE11:16am

Though it comes in spite of Merrill adding the stock to its EM recommended list this morning.

BE11:16am

We add Old Mutual to EEMEA1. We see capital return potential on top of organic growth and efficiency improvement. We now forecasts an 85c per share special dividend in 2019 from proceeds of LatAm disposal. We see scope for OMU to close a near 30% discount vs its peer group, with the spin-out of Nedbank in Q4 a key catalyst.

Excel Developer One of the most prominent down stocks.
BE11:17am

Though I think that's a mechanical thing on the back of an upgrade on Monday.

Soundbuy Redrow boss saying ministers would be 'crazy' to scrap HTB.......bonkers I tell ya.......
Excel Developer Over the last week and last month Old Mutual performing badly but June 12th really tumbled by almost a fifth.
11:18 am
BE11:18am

You've got meetings happening post the (quite weak in spite of the special divi) H1 and you have the Nedbank unbundling to come .... Awaiting and without further information, I'd just suspect some shareholder base churn to reflect its new shape.

Excel Developer ok thanks.
Viking1 Sub prime lending in SA looking very nervous and rumours of new election around the corner The Rand!!
BE11:19am

Nedbank spin's Q4, isn't it? Anyway, if there's anything more useful to say I'll attempt to say it before the end of the show.

undefined
lonrho Why has Vodafone been dropping on a daily basis for weeks when comment seems mostly positive until a couple of very recent downgrades.
Excel Developer South Africa now in recession, the rand pressured.
11:20 am
BE11:20am

Oh, on SA's troubles, I should point you towards Joseph Cotterill's recent reporting.

BE11:21am

https://www.ft.com...-85da-eeb7a9ce36e4

BE11:21am

And on the recession, https://www.ft.com...-8d14-6f049d06439c

11:21 am
undefined
BE11:22am

@lonrho mentions Vodafone

Vodafone Group PLC (VOD:LSE): Last: 164.38, up 0.08 (+0.05%), High: 166.00, Low: 163.92, Volume: 22.68m
11:22 am
BE11:23am

Why it's been dropping recently is pretty simple: same reason the whole sector's been dropping.

BE11:24am

Illiad's been piling into Italy with loss-leader type offers, with its strategy being mirrored all over southern Italy.

BE11:24am

As of today, Bernstein raises a very valid question: "so what?"

11:25 am
BE11:25am

Sure, divi's not covered. And never was. But you're buying Vodafone for what it'll be next year, not what it is now. That's their argument.

BE11:26am

Justified dividend concerns, but for a company that will soon cease to exist in its current form. Dividend cash cover has always been an issue at Vodafone. As this analyst should know, the company's commitment to paying it is almost religious. Insurgents in Southern Europe are inflicting damage on Vodafone's European portfolio. Strength in Germany and modest improvements in the UK are proving insufficient to pick up the slack. In AMAP, FX continues to deteriorate. All true, but for a company that is on the cusp of major structural transformation.

Markkus VOD yielding 8% if it's sustainable. Not covered by earnings, but that's been the case for quite some time.
BE11:26am

By which they mean the Liberty asset swap, of course.

11:27 am
BE11:27am

EU's approval of Ziggo suggests it'll clear Vod-Lib, they say.

BE11:28am

So you end up with Vodafone's op cashflow being one-third Germany.

BE11:28am

The path to deleveraging despite the headwinds in Southern Europe and the transaction costs is convincing. Most crucially, dividend cash cover is set to improve.

Excel Developer Good piece by Joseph on SA. Also, Russel Napier writes about global investors increasing risks of being stiffed by the rise of "strong man" regimes. Joseph's SA piece speaks to that.
11:28 am
BE11:28am

So, buy up to 230p.

BE11:28am

'OldVod' is trading at a c.20% discount to the sector. We value the pro-forma business at 17x EV/OpCF (BERNe '19/20 incl. integration costs), a c.15% premium to sector multiples of 14.9x EV/OpCF on consensus 2019 estimates. Justifiable, as the implied multiple before integration costs represents a 7% premium to the sector, in line with Vodafone's five-year valuation history. The catalyst? EU approval of the deal in Q2'19.

undefined
Tom Dalgleish Should be a different term than “strong man”. More like arrogant man
11:30 am
BE11:30am

What else we got? I guess there's the daily three-ring-and-one-clown circus that is Tesla.

Tom Dalgleish Is VodLib a 5G play?
BE11:31am

https://www.buzzfe...ons-buzzfeed-email

BE11:33am

In which Buzzfeed uses a rather artistic interpretation of the concept of "off the record" to report an email from Mr Musk that I can't quote, for decency reasons as much as legal ones.

Tom Dalgleish But Russ would have done his research
11:33 am
BE11:33am

How long's this going to go on for?

Ethelred Maybe it's a cunning distraction better from model 3 production and margin fgiures
BE11:34am

Shareholders must, surely, intervene at some stage. The corporate single-person risk works both ways.

VV75 this goes on till he's relieved of duty
Viking1 Cobalt production Congo and South Africa controls 70% , the Chinese wants it / buying the mines
Ethelred or until he lays off the Ambien n Acid cocktails
BE11:35am

Back on earth, you'll have seen Goldman restarted Tesla with a sell yesterday. Having suspended on the reverse-engineered nonsense vapourware buyout thing.

11:35 am
BE11:35am

We have removed the NR designation from TSLA shares. We add
TSLA to the Sell List with a 6-month price target of $210. While we
see the potential for a better near-term backdrop with growth in
Model 3 production/deliveries driving positive FCF in 2H18, we
believe this will likely not be sustained as working capital tailwinds
abate and as spending ramps back up after a period of cash
conservation. Further, we see the medium-to-longer term industry
backdrop as challenging for Tesla’s products; this follows from an
increasing number of EV launches from both traditional OEMs and
other start-up competitors – at a time when the company’s product
cadence hits a gap. Ultimately, we believe the intensifying industry
dynamics combined with the phase out of the US Federal EV Tax
Credit for Tesla customers – driving an exhaustion of higher price
point buyers – could weigh on company gross margins and
profitability. Altogether, we remain bearish on the company’s ability
to execute, achieve its targeted production ramp/margins, and
sustain FCF generation.

BE11:37am

They say no proper volume of Model Y before 2021, a year after the potential launch, which gives competitors time to overtake.

Viking1 Meet out with first Electric model, announced yesterday Tesla short of the quarterApple will buy something different
BE11:37am

Plus the phase-out of the $7,500 US Federal EV Tax Credit beginning in 1Q19

Excel Developer This is what moved Old Mutual ~12 June https://www.ft.com/content/290fe878-6d64-11e8-92d3-6c13e5c92914
Viking1 Mercedes making their first Electric. ....
11:37 am
BE11:38am

The company has seen net-debt balances 3. increase each quarter – partly due to its on-balance sheet lease activities, but also as cash has declined. Customer deposits have helped keep the company above our estimate for
minimum cash balance (i.e., a $2bn level given historical quarterly FCF burn of $1bn), but recently saw a sequential decline. With looming maturities on convertible debt, we believe the company would likely need to come back to the capital markets in 1H19.

Excel Developer so it was a corporate action, not a market move, ... doh.
BE11:38am

Our 2018 through 2020 adjusted EBITDA estimates remain an average 19% below FactSet consensus expectations, largely from a slower demand cadence and lower forecast gross margin trajectory.

BE11:38am

You get the idea.

urgeview Any chance of some FDEV coverage ? TIA.
Tom Dalgleish @Viking, who would rescue TSLA may be the more important question and when
11:39 am
undefined
Tom Dalgleish Maybe Lord Elon meant takeover at $3.20 per share
nichoman FDEV seems to be approaching merely expensive valuation assuming its sales forecast is realistic. given the sector, im nibbling at expensive in the hope of a return to ridiculous
BE11:42am

Frontier Devs? Sure, guess so.

Frontier Developments PLC (FDEV:LSE): Last: 997.36, down 62.64 (-5.91%), High: 1,100, Low: 932.00, Volume: 205.97k
mosschops What's going to move the price with FDEV? Next full game not due until 2020 is it?
11:42 am
BE11:42am

Arguably the quality name of the UK listed video game space, which is becoming increasingly crowded.

BE11:44am

Though quality ain't cheap and full-year results that meet forecasts, with no guidance update, are probably not enough to keep the bulls happy.

BE11:44am

Numbers first:

Viking1 Apple continues to be the suggested acquirer of Tesla
11:44 am
BE11:44am

You have revenue of £34m and op profit of £2.8m, which is pretty much exactly what was flagged in the June trading update.

BE11:45am

Co remains comfortable with the £75m - £88m consensus

BE11:46am

In terms of guidance, there's nothing much new. Franchise Four will be released in 2020, with 2 more franchises in early-stage development

Soundbuy FDEV - didn't they flag at the upper end in June?
VV75 any comments on the William Hill partnership?
11:46 am
BE11:46am

A reminder that the Frontier investment case is in part based on getting enough AAA franchises to rotate and deliver decent annual earnings., rather than decent bi-annual earnings.

BE11:47am

That looks to be a slow process, as you ought to expect from a company that aims for quality rather than churn. Here's Citi.

BE11:48am

FY18 result is largely inconsequential as we look towards the earnings uplift in FY19e with the launch of Jurassic World Evolution (JWE). FY18 revenues declined -9% after no new franchises were released; however we view it as solid result with a better-than-expected performance across its back catalogue franchises, Elite and Planet Coaster.

majicka Keywords Studios has results coming up on the 21st. They do lots of different types of outsourcing to games companies, but have done well.
11:48 am
BE11:48am

Franchise 4 — No reveal of title but announced that it will be own-IP and released in FY20, which is in line with Citi expectations. Our FY20e estimates factor in £25m revenue generation for Franchise 4, which we believe offers significant earnings upside as it only represents another Planet Coaster franchise which we expect to be understated given that future games should be developed across all platforms.

BE11:49am

"Own IP" is probably a good thing. Some of us are old enough to remember Atari and ET .....

BE11:49am

As to dinosaurs:

11:49 am
BE11:49am

JWE Update — No update provided on JWE following the announcement that 1 million units were sold after 5 weeks, versus our estimates of 1.8 million for the full year and 1 million achieved after close to 12 months for Planet Coaster. We identified a small price discounting initiative on the PC JWE game in late August 2018, coinciding with a free update and expect price discounting to be used into the important Christmas and Thanksgiving period at the end of CY18.

Imperial Goldsmith Horizon/ ValueAct?
BE11:50am

So . shares down on very little news because they trade at 47 times 2018 and incalculable 2019, as that's one of the fallow years meaning it's going to be lossmaking.

BE11:50am

Citi retains buy, tho.

Penny MorningWilliam Hill / Eldorado ?
11:50 am
BE11:51am

Our Buy rating and target price of £15.40 reflects a 45% expected
return and is driven off our belief that Frontier Developments will successfully buildout a portfolio of game franchises. Our target price implies a £50m revenue generation franchise per annum from FY21e, which we deem reasonable being the midpoint of our expectations for Planet Coaster and JWE.

Imperial Goldsmith Woodford has prev VA engagement w/ Rolls - intriguing dynamic
BE11:51am

Have Jefferies as well, since we're here.

BE11:52am

Despite the success of JWE, film spin-offs have a mixed record (Star Wars Battlefront and JWE the only top 100 games from films in 1H18), so while FDEV has burnished its creds for more movie madness, we’re confident in its ability to monetise owned IP. Besides F4, the company continues to stress other potential opportunities: publish external IP; use work-for-hire developers; or make acquisitions to expand its game portfolio. We reiterate our Buy case for FDEV’s progress toward a broader base of AAA games, now launching yearly, generating a more diverse and sustainable profit profile over coming years, backed by a strong balance sheet (before JWE’s proceeds are banked).

11:52 am
BE11:52am

mosschops SWB did badly because EA hid half the content behind additional paywalls, people have declining patience for that. Don't think there's that much read across to JWE.
Soundbuy Another Toyota recall ...........zzzzz
BE11:53am

And I'm sure anyone with a history of forecasting video game sales when the title's still being coded will view that chart with the required degree of caution.

undefined
urgeview Cheers BE.
Provender Not sure there's much left in the tank for JWE without some kind of expansion.Current Twitch viewers:Fortnite 60kPUBG 40kJWE: 5 (not k)
11:54 am
BE11:54am

Horizon-Valueact was yesterday, no?

Soundbuy FDEV - now off over 8%...............
BE11:55am

Valueact turning up with a 5% stake: https://www.invest...1809040700176443Z/

Pharma That chart is the work of someone who searched google images with the keyword "jurassic", and came up with a schematic of the Jurassic Coast geology.
Provender Elite Dangerous: 168 and that was released what 4 years ago?
Electric Dragon It's difficult enough for a publisher themselves to predict release dates when the title's under development. (see: https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Valve_Time )
Forester @BE exactly. For example where is Minecraft now sold out for $1bn?
BE11:57am

What does Valueact know about gene editing? I've no idea.

11:57 am
BE11:58am

It's also post poor results from Horizon on Monday, on which Peel Hunt said:

BE11:58am

Our thesis on Horizon has always been that consensus built in unrealistic revenue growth expectations over the near term. We updated our model to adjust our forecast for mix and scale of revenue to recognise the current trajectories and slight re-jig of reporting format. The company expects to beat our estimates slightly on margin, but this is more than offset by greater opex costs in the near term to support commercial growth. We remain Hold and look forward to more details at the H1 results on 17 September.

Forester Or the legendary "Matthew Smith" (a hero to us 80s gamers) - where is he now?
BE11:59am

It's not implausible that Valueact would push for a sale, given Horizon's trading at about 4 times next year's sales in a sector where we've seen rather poppier valuations

wayneJ Worth reading the full FDEV statement - I think the next 2 years could be very positive
12:00 pm
BE12:00pm

Small beer for them though.

Blank canvas thanks for everything today
wayneJ Interesting that essentially Elite updates were free last yr
undefined
wayneJ Also the comment re outsourcing and that they have 4/5/6 franchises in the pipeline
BE12:01pm

Quick line on William Hill, since it was requested. Kleinmanator had details overnight.

12:01 pm
BE12:02pm

Davy to summarise:

BE12:02pm

Following similar agreements made by Paddy Power Betfair and
GVC Holdings, William Hill has announced that it is to partner with
Eldorado Resorts in the US, extending its market access to 13
states. The partnership will see William Hill sportsbooks launched
in a number of states within weeks and it positions the group well
to benefit as further states allow sports betting. In return, William
Hill will give Eldorado a 20% stake in its existing and future US
operations, alongside equity in the parent group.

wayneJ Re JWE - the sales in China of the film were surprisingly good; so even with existing franchise the other issue mkt is missing is geographical expansion
BE12:02pm

In our view, the ‘cost’ of such a partnership is threefold. Eldorado will receive a 20% stake in William Hill’s US business giving it: i) a portion of William Hill’s existing business in the region (it currently has operations in six states as well as in the Bahamas and St Kitts, which generated c.£23m of adjusted operating profits in 2017); ii) a similar percentage of any future Eldorado or non-Eldorado US activities; iii) Eldorado will receive $50m of stock in William Hill plc, subject to a 3-5 year lockup.

Penny @BE thk you
wayneJ Also mgmt has a few days of meetings and they tend to come across well; plus the forecasts don't make sense in the out years.
12:03 pm
BE12:03pm

And MOST.

BE12:04pm

While both sides will benefit from the partnership, William Hill is giving Eldorado ~£116m of value (14p per William Hill share, 5% of its share price) but not receiving any equity in return, so this seems to be the price William Hill has to pay for exclusivity with Eldorado.

wayneJ Isn't PS/5 and Xbox Scalett due in 2020 or 2021 which will usually lead to massive cycle
BE12:05pm

.............. which is interesting observation. I'd have thought it'd be a buyers' market for the scale bookies looking to sign up US casinos, but apparently not.

12:05 pm
BE12:06pm

Peel Hunt .....

BE12:07pm

Clock ticking for a bid? There have been rumours of corporate interest in a bid for William Hill. Today’s announcement could help to crystallise any such interest if the bidder wanted to forestall the deal with Eldorado completing; expected Q119.

BE12:07pm

That's Ivor Jones. And I'm not sure if he's referring to the ever-present rumours around William Hill or something more specific.

12:07 pm
BE12:08pm

Success in the US will be represented by the opportunity to invest. If
multiple states regulate sports betting in 2019, William Hill US will be
investing capex and opex with its partners to exploit those opportunities.
The direction of the share price will be determined by how much good news comes from early adopting states while that investment takes place. We believe that the market continues to undervalue the upside.

wayneJ @Mosschops - FDEV next game launch is in fiscal 2020 but it is a May year end co! So likely to be summer / autumn 2019
BE12:10pm

PaddyPower + GVC were of course strongly rumoured last year to be working on a breakup bid for William Hill .... GVC then landed Ladbrokes, of course .....

BE12:11pm

.................. so, does PaddyPower-William Hill make sense as a standalone deal? Lots of high street closures, probably, but that's not a bad thing facing down the FOBT cap.

12:11 pm
BE12:11pm

Anyway, that's that noted.

undefined
BE12:12pm

Hey, look at the time.

12:12 pm
BE12:12pm

More stuff over here, as always: https://www.ft.com/stocks-to-watch

VV75 ta
BE12:13pm

Ta for joining. Ta for your insight into dinosaur games.

BE12:13pm

Back tomorrow. Afternoon all.
